    • printLobbyCommands

      public <T extends Enum<T> & Commands> void printLobbyCommands(Class<T> enumClass)
      Prints CommandsLobby.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the commands enumeration
      Parameters:

    • allCommands

      public void allCommands(int phase)
      Prints CommandsTurn based on the given phase. The commands of the specified phase will be printed in a different color.
      Parameters:
      phase - the phase number

    • printCommands

      public void printCommands(CommandsTurn commandsTurn)
      Prints the corresponding view based on the provided command.
      Parameters:
      commandsTurn - the command to determine the view to print

    • checkCommand

      public Commands checkCommand(int phase)
      Checks the user input for a command based on the given phase.
      Parameters:
      phase - the phase number
      Returns:
      the command corresponding to the user input, or null if the input is invalid or out of range

    • handleInvalidPhase

      public boolean handleInvalidPhase(CommandsTurn commandsTurn)
      Handles an invalid phase for the given command.
      Parameters:
      commandsTurn - the command that triggered the invalid phase
      Returns:
      true if the user has selected the "somethingWrong", false otherwise If the provided command is "somethingWrong", the server will be contacted to sets all attributes in the client view.

    • askCoordinates

      public void askCoordinates()
      Asks the user to enter coordinates for tile selection. Displays the board and prompts for commands to select and confirm tile coordinates. Continues asking for commands until a valid confirmation command is received.
      Specified by:
      askCoordinates in interface ClientInterface

    • askOrder

      public void askOrder()
      Asks the user to input the order of the selected tiles. The method displays the order phase and prompts the user to enter numbers from 0 to N-1, where N is the number of selected tiles. The user's input represents the desired order of the tiles.
      Specified by:
      askOrder in interface ClientInterface

    • askColumn

      public void askColumn()
      Asks the user to select a column for placing the selected tiles. The method displays the column phase and prompts the user to enter a number from 0 to N-1, where N is the number of columns in the bookshelf. The user's input represents the desired column for tile placement.
      Specified by:
      askColumn in interface ClientInterface

    • displayError

      public void displayError(String error)
      Displays an error message to the user.
      Specified by:
      displayError in interface ClientInterface
      Parameters:
      error - the error message to display

    • displayMessage

      public void displayMessage(String string)
      Displays a message to the user.
      Specified by:
      displayMessage in interface ClientInterface
      Parameters:
      string - the message to display

    • endGame

      public void endGame(int[] personalPoints, String playerBookshelfFull)
      Ends the game and displays the end game results.
      Specified by:
      endGame in interface ClientInterface
      Parameters:
      personalPoints - an array containing the personal points of each player
      playerBookshelfFull - the nickname indicating the player who completed their bookshelf first After displaying the end game results, the client view will receive the end game notification The user will be prompted to enter "ok" to return to the lobby. Once the user enters "ok", the function will exit and control will return to the lobby.

    • onlyPlayer

      public void onlyPlayer()
      Displays an error message indicating that the current player is the only player connected to the game, and they need to wait for another player to join before they can continue. Additionally, it prints a logo indicating the "Only Player" status.
      Specified by:
      onlyPlayer in interface ClientInterface

    • waitingRoom

      public void waitingRoom()
      Displays the waiting room phase, showing the current turn player, the board, and the current ranking. This phase is displayed while the player is waiting for his/her turn.
      Specified by:
      waitingRoom in interface ClientInterface

    • displayToken

      public void displayToken(int num, String nickname)
      Displays the player who won a token and the associated score.
      Specified by:
      displayToken in interface ClientInterface
      Parameters:
      num - the token number
      nickname - the nickname of the player who won the token

    • getClientView

      public ClientView getClientView()
      Returns the current client view.
      Specified by:
      getClientView in interface ClientInterface
      Returns:
      the client view

    • askNicknameAndConnection

      public void askNicknameAndConnection()
      Establishes a connection with the game server based on the user's input for connection type, nickname, IP address, and port.
      Specified by:
